thesis.description: Lying deep in Mississippi is an area known to many readers of contemporary fiction as Yoknapatawpha County. Here, within an area of 2400 square miles, between the Northern bills and the fertile bottom lands of that state, live approximately fifteen thousand people. This county and these people are the creations of' William Faulkner's fertile imagination, and they form the subject matter of most of his fiction. [...]
thesis.creator: Iversen, James Eric.
thesis.subject: Faulkner, William, 1897
English.
thesis.title: The social ideas of William Faulkner.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: On this continent, year in and year out, thousands of children are placed outside their own homes and family situations. In fact, the problem of child placement has become increasingly important in the field of social work. Prior to this century, child placement in Canada and the United States was not considered to involve complex femily and individual interrelationships. [...]
thesis.creator: Horn, Dorothy.
thesis.subject: Social Work.
thesis.title: Child placement problems in the family agency.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The important role of Uranium from a military and scientific viewpoint has been common knowledge ever since the discovery of fission in 1939. Consequently, the accurate assaying of Uranium in natural ores has necessitated detailed investigat1ons by both physicists and chemists. [...]
thesis.creator: Hilborn, John Wells.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: Equilibrium assaying of uranium ore.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: So many critics have pointed to George Eliot as a symbol of the nineteenth century's religious flux that the idea is becoming a commonplace one. House, for example, in "Qualities of George Eliot's Unbelief", concedes that Eliot is not a typical Victorian, "Yet her history her intellectual and spiritual and moral history -- exemplifies so many trends and qualities of Victorian thought that she deserves to be considered alone." [...]
thesis.creator: Hersh, Jacob.
thesis.subject: English.
Eliot, George, 1819-1880 -- Criticism and interpretation.
Clergy in literature.
Hardy, Thomas, 1840-1928 -- Criticism and interpretation.
thesis.title: Clergymen in George Eliot and Thomas Hardy.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This thesis is presented in two parts. Part I describes a pulser built for the r.f. oscillator of the McGill synchro-cyclotron. Part II describes the study of the behaviour of the internal circulating proton beam of the cyclotron. This investigation reveals that the proton beam has an amplitude of free radial oscillation of 2 inches. [...]
thesis.creator: Henry, William Hunter.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: Study and improvement of the McGill cyclotron.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Ob ein literarisches Kunstwerk von einer spaeteren Generation, im Lichte von dessen Zeit und Kunstanschauung, umgedichtet werden darf, ist eine Frage, die die Kunstkritiker und -historiker lange beschaeftigt hat. Diejenigen, die vor allem die Eigentuemlichkeit eines Genies preisen, werden jede Bearbeitung, jede Auslassung, jeden Zusatz, wodurch die urspruengliche Gestalt und das Wesen des Originals bedroht werden, bekaempfen. [...]
thesis.creator: Haywood, Bruce.
thesis.subject: Shakespeare, William, 1564-1616. Romeo and Juliet.
Goethe, Johann Wolfgang von, 1749-1832.
German.
thesis.title: Studien zu Goethes Bearbeitung von Shakespeares "Romeo und Julia".
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A knowledge or the individual chemical constituents of bark is important not only from an academic point of view, but is of vital interest to the economy of the wood pulp industry in general. For several years, a major investigation of the components of the bark of white spruce (Picea glauca) has been conducted at the Department of Industrial and Cellulose Chemistry at McGill University. [...]
thesis.creator: Harpham, John Arthur.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: Further separations of the watersoluble components of white spruce bark.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: High speed electrical counting may in many situations lead to large dead-time corrections. The corrections became greatly magnified when the process being studied is simultaneous with the arrival of particles from the pulsed output ot a modern particle accelerator. [...]
thesis.creator: Greenberg, Jack Sam.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: A study of counting losses due to "dead-time" of counting circuits.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Matte smelting of copper ores and concentrates in North America is carried on entirely in reverberatory and blast furnaces; but in Scandinavia, where fuels are scarce and hydro-electric power is available in quantity, electric furnaces are used for smelting operations. Each type of smelting furnace has its own peculiar advantages and disadvantages, the furnace used being a matter of economics. [...]
thesis.creator: Goth, John William.
thesis.subject: Metallurgical Engineering.
thesis.title: An investigation of the electric smelting of copper concentrates.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Adolescence is a subject that has been written about widely in the past four decades. Psychologists, educators, medical men, sociologists, anthropologists, and social workers have concerned themselves with the phenomenon that makes the twelve to twenty-one year old an enigma to his family and the community at large. [...]
thesis.creator: Goldstein, Mindel.
thesis.subject: Social Work.
thesis.title: Problems of late adolescence as seen at psychiatric clinic.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Ceux qui s'intéressent à la littérature savent que la période la plus fructueuse de la carrière de Victor Hugo est celle des dix-huit années qu'il passa en exil aux îles de Jersey et Guernesey. Pendant ce temps son génie littéraire est en pleine floraison: il donne La Légende des Siècles, Les Contemplations, et Les Misérables. [...]
thesis.creator: Glover, Thomas William.
thesis.subject: French.
Hugo, Victor, 1802-1885 -- Political and social views.
thesis.title: Les idées politiques et sociales de Victor Hugo en exil d’après ses discours et sa correspondance.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

degree.name: Master of Arts
degree.discipline: Department of French Language and Literature

thesis.description: The Canadian Shield is predominantly composed of rocks of Precambrian age. It contains numerous belts and isolated masses of volcanic and sedimentary rocks in which many of the gold and base metal deposits of Canada are found. These however, represent only a small part of the "Shield". The· bulk of it is composed of gneisses and schists, believed to bave been formed from ancient sedimentary, volcanic, and plutonic rocks, by metamorphism. [...]
thesis.creator: Gillies, Norman Bain.
thesis.subject: Geological Sciences.
thesis.title: The geology of the Caniniti river area, Pontiac county, Quebec.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The Premier (Transvaal) Diamond Mine is situated at the village of Cullinan, approximately 20 miles E.N.E. of Pretoria, the administrative capital of the Union of South Africa. It lies at an elevation of 4,722 feet above sea level. A paved highway connects Cullinan with Pretoria, and a spur-line, runs from the village to the Pretoria-Lourenco Marques railway. [...]
thesis.creator: Gerryts, Egbert.
thesis.subject: Geological Sciences.
thesis.title: The petrology of the kimberlites at the Premier (Transvaal) diamond mine, South Africa.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The outbreak of the second world war greatly stimulated investigations on the preservation and use of blood. Numerous groups of workers attacked this problem and rapidly improved methods of preservation and methods for following the survival of red blood cells after transfusion. [...]
thesis.creator: Francoeur, Marc.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: Hexosemonophosphate oxidation and methemoglobin reduction in human erythrocytes.

thesis.description: Radar equipment operating at a frequency of 106.5 Mc/s was used to investigate polar aurora. Radio reflections were observed and their characteristics determined by means of directive aerial arrays, one of which was rotatable about a vertical axis. [...]
thesis.creator: Forsyth, P. A. (Peter Allan).
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: A radio investigation of aurora.

thesis.description: The Historical Introduction relating to the various aspects of this investigation will be divided into the following parts: 1) Statistical study of the heterogeneity of paper, 2) Physical factors affecting paper heterogeneity, and 3) Correlation of the physical properties of paper with the degree of heterogeneity. [...]
thesis.creator: Favis, Demetrios Vasilios.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: Studies of the effect of fibre flocculation on the heterogeneity of paper.

thesis.description: Some congenital defects are known to have a genetic etiology while others are caused by environmental influences impinging directly upon the developing embryo, or indirectly by interferring with normal maternal-fetal relationships. Still others depend on an interplay of both environmental and genetic factors, since the same agent, administered to groups of animals of different genetic constitutions, can cause congenitally malformed young in one group while normal offspring result in another. [...]
thesis.creator: Fainstat, Theodore Douglas.
thesis.subject: Animal behavior.
Cortisone.
Genetics.
thesis.title: Effects of the administration of cortisone during pregnancy on mice and their offspring.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This study at the Allan Memorial Institute of Psychiatry was undertaken to find out what had been accomplished with those cases in which social reception had taken place. Social reception is the process of helping the patient to accept his hospitalization, of relieving his fears and threats to his status in the community, of allowing him to respond to the therapeutic potentialities of living experienced under psychiatric supervision and direction. [...]
thesis.creator: Emerson, Marion.
thesis.subject: Social Work.
thesis.title: Social reception cases in a psychiatric hospital.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Children are an essential part of every human society. The community, large or small, depends for its future leadership, indeed for its very existence, on that portion of its population who are children. During the period of their immaturity, however, these children are dependent upon the adults in the population for meeting their basic needs. [...]
thesis.creator: Duitman, Dorothy I.
thesis.subject: Social Work.
thesis.title: Children in need of protection and care in Saskatchewan : fulfilling public responsibility for child protection and care through temporary wardship.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Planning is necessarily suspect in a country which prides itself on a tradition of liberalism and rugged individualism, and the charge of impracticabality lies ready to hand for the eager detractor. It is the more regrettable that this should be so since many of the exponents of planning have been particularly careful to emphasize that pious sentiments, even when allied with superb aesthetic sense, will not provide a satiafactory plan. [...]
thesis.creator: Dickson, Delphine Mary.
thesis.subject: Sociology.
thesis.title: The contribution of human ecology to physical planning.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Panta rei - said Heraklitus, everything in in this world is constantly changing. This is especially true of living organisms. Their ability to adapt themselves to changes within and without is very remarkable, and it provides the best possible way of life and reproduction. [...]
thesis.creator: Dekaban, Anatole S.
thesis.subject: Neurology & Neurosurgery.
thesis.title: The human thalamus: anatomical and developmental study.

thesis.description: Tuberoulosis as a disease has many characteristics which are common to most of the ills to which human beings are subject. There are, however, certain characteristics that are peculiar to tuberculosis with the potentiality of exerting damaging influence upon human personality. It must be conceded that in any attempt to understand the behaviour of tuberculous patients, it is unavoidable to give consideration to the emotional and psychic components of tuberculosis. [...]
thesis.creator: Dalmau, Luz Nilda Acosta.
thesis.subject: Social Work.
thesis.title: Emotional problems of tuberculous patients.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The design and construction of a microwave signal generator have been discussed. A 10 cm. signal generator has been built and the absolute available output power of the signal generator has been precisely calibrated. This involved calibrating a cutoff attenuator which controlled the power output, and a measurement of the absolute available output power at low attenuation. [...]
thesis.creator: Crowell, Clarence Robert.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: Precision equipment for measurement on a double-stream microwave amplifier tube.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The use of herbicides and insecticides in agricultural practices may influence, directly or indirectly, both the microflora of the soil and the development of plants. Because of the increasing use of compounds of this nature in agriculture it is imperative that such effects should be studied to avert possible damage to large sections of arable land. [...]
thesis.creator: Corbett, Wendell O’Neil.
thesis.subject: Agricultural Bacteriology.
thesis.title: The effects of benzene hexachloride on bacteria in the rhizosphere of leguminous plants.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: During the summer of 1949, the Geological Survey of Canada carried out a reconnaissance survey of the east coast of Labrador between Hamilton Inlet and Hopedale. Dr. E. H. Kranck, Professor of Petrology, McGill University, was the leader of this party. Dr Kranck had previously examined the rocks of the coastal region in 1937, as a member of the Finland-Labrador Expedition, and in 1939 as a leader of a second expedition from Finland. [...]
thesis.creator: Cooper, Gerald Ernest.
thesis.subject: Geological Sciences.
thesis.title: The petrology of some syenites and granites in Labrador.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.
